item.title: Trip to Dominican Republic turns into vacation from hell: 'We've lost everything'...
item.description:
www.msn.com
It was supposed to be an eight-day getaway, a chance for three South Florida brothers to reconnect with family living in the Dominican Republic amid coronavirus lockdowns and quarantine. But four days in, the trip in late July 2020 turned into the yearlong vacation from hell. Now the three brothers hope that a hearing on Monday may finally lead to their ticket back home. The Nalus brothers — ...

item.title: Rashad offers 'most sincere apology' to Howard students for celebrating release...
item.description:
www.cbsnews.com
"I intend to earn your trust and your forgiveness," the former actress wrote in an email addressed to Howard University students and parents.

item.title: Vigilantes claimed voter fraud. A thousand false leads later, investigators found one case...
item.description:
news.yahoo.com
The Riverside County investigation illustrates the challenge authorities face when dealing with allegations of massive voter fraud.

item.title: Kamala isn't getting any honeymoon, and some Dems are fretting...
item.description:
news.yahoo.com
Harris' poll numbers have consistently lagged behind Biden's, and she's getting bad press. Some allies worry the White House doesn't have her back.

item.title: FBI muscles up against hackers...
item.description:
finance.yahoo.com
(Bloomberg) -- For the last several years, FBI agents debated turning the tables on hackers by remotely accessing breached computer networks and booting out the attackers caught in mid-hack.They got their chance earlier this year after state-backed Chinese hackers compromised thousands of private Microsoft Exchange email servers. In response, an FBI special agent petitioned a Houston federal judge on April 9 for authorization to remotely access hundreds of hacking victims’ computer networks and

item.title: Putin 'lockdown lite' as Moscow stops millions from dining out...
item.description:
www.stripes.com
As the COVID-19 pandemic rears up again in Russia, President Vladimir Putin is following Israel’s example as Moscow stops millions of residents from entering bars and restaurants without proof of vaccination or recovery from the illness.

item.title: 'Are we next?' Worried high-rise dwellers take photos, seek answers...
item.description:
www.msn.com
SURFSIDE, Fla. — After the Champlain Towers South Condo collapsed a couple of miles away from his home, Miami Beach resident Dan Ribeiro began feverishly snapping photos of what he said were concerning conditions in the garage of his high-rise — a condo taller and older than the one that partially collapsed in Surfside. He is so worried about the cracked concrete, rusted steel and water ...

item.title: Vanessa Williams to Sing 'Black National Anthem' at Capitol Celebration...
item.description:
www.yahoo.com
American actress and singer Vanessa Williams will perform the song "Lift Every Voice and Sing," which has become known as the "black national anthem," at the annual A Capitol Fourth televised celebration.

item.title: DEMOLITION TOMORROW...
item.description:
apnews.com
SURFSIDE, Fla. (AP) — Demolition workers planned to bring down the remainder of a collapsed condo building on Sunday ahead of an approaching storm that added to worries that the damaged structure could come down on its own, officials said Saturday.

item.title: Spokane-Coeur d'Alene housing market booming, prices rising...
item.description:
apnews.com
SPOKANE, Wash. (AP) — The way Darin Watkins sees it, the real estate boom in the once-sleepy Spokane, Washington, metropolitan area is a numbers problem. Far too many people are moving in, far too few homes are being built and prices have skyrocketed.

item.title: Vegas bouncing back, but virus on rise too...
item.description:
apnews.com
LAS VEGAS (AP) — Fifteen months after the pandemic transformed Las Vegas from flamboyant spectacle to ghost town, Sin City is back. Tourists are streaming in again, gambling revenue has hit an all-time high, the Las Vegas Strip has its first new casino in a decade, and big concerts are starting at a gleaming new stadium.

item.title: As Biden hosts 1,000 for Independence Day, desire to declare victory collides with need for caution...
item.description:
www.msn.com
The White House wants to celebrate the country’s big strides toward normalcy. But a victory lap could suggest the crisis is over, a potentially dangerous message.

item.title: 9 people in custody after hourslong armed standoff on I-95...
item.description:
apnews.com
WAKEFIELD, Mass. (AP) — Massachusetts state police said nine suspects have been taken into custody following an hourslong standoff that prompted the partial closure of Interstate 95. Police said the suspects include two people who were arrested earlier on Saturday.

item.title: Brazil Supreme Court greenlights investigation of Bolsonaro...
item.description:
apnews.com
RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — A Brazilian Supreme Court justice has authorized a criminal investigation into President Jair Bolsonaro’s response to allegations of potential corruption within his Health Ministry involving a vaccine deal.
